inline xbrl viewer application relies heavily javascript need allow javascript to use this application inline viewer menu menu information save xbrl instance save xbrl zip file open html setting help section section additional search option include fact name include fact content include label include definition include dimension reference option include topic include sub topic include paragraph include publisher include section match case clear search submit search data data amount text only calculation only negative only additional item only tag tag all standard only custom only filter more filter selecting will take moment period measure axis explicit typed member explicit typed scale balance debit credit reset all filter link fact inline xbrl html form performance may affected using google chrome help alleviate of performance issue loading inline form tagged section search all search in internal section only search in external section only clear section search submit section search help getting started the inline xbrl viewer allows user to quickly easily review detail of the tagged information in inline document automatically placing top and bottom highlight border around tagged numeric fact and left and right border each block tagged fact hovering over tagged fact will highlight shade all content related to the tagged fact and clicking on tagged fact will reveal tagging detail in the fact review window navigation search and filter option also provided to easily refine and identify specific type of tagged information fact review window the fact review window show the tagging detail for the currently selected fact is highlighted solid blue border are four category of fact detail which can be viewed an value indicates there is available information for the item within the given category attribute all primary information applicable describing the tagged fact including period sign decimal dimensional detail ax and member scale measure and data type label detailed documentation definition for the tag used and label reference authoritative reference information applicable for the selected tag calculation balance and calculation hierarchy detail numeric non dimensioned item only searching there are two way to search the document fact and section to search information enter keyword in search box and select the magnifying glass icon to return matching result search operator and via and and or via or or are available to refine search fact the search fact box can be used to find tagged fact matching entered keywords by default tag name tag label and tagged content are included in search tagged fact matching the search criterion are shown with yellow colored default shading on the page and appear in the fact list select the button to the left of the magnifying glass icon to clear the search the content included in search can be increased to included tag definition dimension and authoritative reference by selecting the cog wheel icon to the left of the search box see setting for more information section the search section box can be used to filter the tagged section of the financial statement filter filter change the number of highlighted fact and item in the fact list by providing several way to review and pinpoint certain tagged information multiple filter can be used data filter these filter option allow the user to refine the highlighted tagged fact by data type all display all tagged data default amount only numeric fact only text only textual fact only calculation only numeric fact participating in calculation only negative only negative numeric amount only additional item only tagged fact without corresponding html presentation hidden fact only tag filter these filter allow the user to refine the highlighted fact by tag type all display all tagged data default standard only fact with standard tag common taxonomy us_gaap ifrs dei custom only fact with extension custom tag unique to the entity document more filter additional filter allow user to further refine the highlighted fact period list of all used context year and reporting period measure list of all used unit of measure dollar applicable axis list of all used axis dimension applicable dimension applicable scale list of all used scaled option thousand million applicable balance debit credit applicable multiple filter work in conjunction with each other for example selecting the amount only data filter and custom only tag filter will highlight only numeric tagged fact using custom tag and list in the fact list active filter are displayed in the filter toolbar are selected active filter can be removed individually by unchecking or selecting all option for each filter or all at once via the reset all filter option fact list result on the toolbar select the count to the right of the word fact fact to reveal the fact list result navigable listing of all currently highlighted tagged fact the count represents the current number of fact by default all tagged fact are displayed in the fact list result the list content and count reflects the currently highlighted fact filter and search criterion refine the list to match the highlighted tagged fact navigation control are available to move the list well move the current view to the corresponding highlighted fact location automatically fact in the fact result list is selected will reveal the fact review window certain letter may appear to the right of an item in the fact result list to indicate certain property the letter appears for fact it indicates the fact is additional data hidden with potentially no corresponding html presentation if the letter appears the fact is tagged with custom tag if the letter appears the fact is tagged with dimensional information section the section toolbar item provides listing of the tagged section of the inline document section are divided three group document entity information financial statement note to the financial statement by expanding group and selecting section item in the listing inline xbrl viewer will navigate to that section when the tagged section feature is open the search section box will additionally filter the list of section to only section that match the entered criterion menu information the information menu item provides additional detail the current inline document and customizable viewer setting company and document basic company and document information tag fact and tag standard and custom information file file used additional item additional hidden data that tagged potentially corresponding location in the html save xbrl instance the save xbrl instance menu item allows an xbrl instance document xml that is extracted from the inline document to be saved locally for use by software supporting the xbrl format save xbrl zip the save xbrl zip menu item allows zip file zip that contains the provided xbrl instance document and related custom taxonomy file to be saved locally setting the setting menu item provides the ability to customize viewer feature tagged fact hover on display the hover fact review window for any tagged fact hide the hover fact review window for any tagged fact default may impact performance with certain web browser auto scrolling position this setting will have no effect on ie or safari top selecting fact from the section menu or the fact menu will automatically scroll that element to the top of the inline xbrl viewer window default center selecting fact from the section menu or the fact menu will automatically scroll that element to the middle of the inline xbrl viewer window highlight color use the save and reset button to save the selected setting or reset to default tagged data change the highlight color of the tagged fact border search result change the background color of tagged item matching the search result selected fact change the color of highlight border used to identify the currently selected fact tag shading hover change the color of the shading applied to tagged data on hover search option match case match the specific case of the entered search keyword include label extends search to include tag label include definition extends search to include tag definition include dimension extends search to include dimensional detail include reference extends search to include authoritative reference information optionally specify the reference part to include in the search topic subtopic section help this content version indicates the current build of the inline xbrl viewer application fact capital about our executive of contentsbusiness overview strategyas used in this form metlife the company we our and refer to metlife inc delaware corporation incorporated in it subsidiary and affiliate metlife is one of the world leading financial service company providing insurance annuity employee benefit and asset management we hold leading market position in the united state japan latin america asia europe and the middle east we are also one of the largest institutional investor in the united state with general account portfolio invested primarily in fixed income security corporate structured product municipals and government and agency and mortgage loan well real estate real estate joint venture other limited partnership and equity security our well recognized brand globally diversified and market leading business competitive and innovative product offering and financial strength and expertise should help drive future growth and enhance shareholder value over the course of the next several year we will continue to execute on our next horizon strategy creating value focusing on the following three pillar focus generate strong free cash flow by deploying capital and resource to the highest value opportunity simplify simplify our business to deliver operational efficiency and an outstanding customer experience differentiate drive competitive advantage through our brand scale talent and innovation metlife is organized into five segment asia latin america europe the middle east and africa emea and metlife holding in addition the company report certain of it result of operation in corporate other see segment and corporate other and note of the note to the consolidated financial statement for further information on the company segment and corporate other of contentsin the united state we provide variety of insurance and financial service product including life dental disability vision accident health capital market investment property and casualty guaranteed interest stable value and annuity outside the united state we provide life medical dental credit and other accident health insurance well annuity endowment and retirement saving product we believe these business will generally continue to grow more quickly than our united state business of contentssegments and corporate other our business in the segment offer broad range of protection product and service aimed at serving the financial need of our customer throughout life these product are sold to corporation and their respective employee other institution and their respective member well individual our segment is organized into three business group benefit retirement and income solution ri and property casualty group benefitswe have built leading position in the united state group insurance market through long standing relationship with many of the largest corporate employer in the united state our group benefit business offer life insurance dental group short and long term disability ltd individual disability accidental death and dismemberment ad insurance vision and accident health insurance well prepaid legal plan we also sell administrative service only aso arrangement to some employer see note of the note to the consolidated financial statement for information regarding the company acquisition of versant health inc versant health managed vision care company we distribute group benefit product and service through sale force primarily comprised of metlife employee that is segmented by the size of the target customer account executive sell either directly to corporate and other group customer or through an intermediary such broker or consultant employer have been emphasizing voluntary product and result we have increased our focus on communicating and marketing to employee in order to further foster sale of those product we have entered into several operating joint venture and other arrangement with third party to expand opportunity to market and distribute group benefit product and service we also sell our group benefit product and service through sponsoring association and affinity group and provide life dental accident health and vision coverage to certain employee of the government we have longstanding relationship with these employee and continue to cultivate and expand them through additional product offering group benefit business quarterly claim experience may vary seasonal illness effect mortality and morbidity and due to utilization rate fluctuation in our non medical health business annual benefit renewal implementation enrollment and marketing cost normally elevate group benefit business expense in the fourth quarter of contentsmajor productsterm life insurancea guaranteed benefit upon the death of the insured for specified time period in return for the periodic payment of premium premium may be guaranteed at level amount for the coverage period or may be non level and non guaranteed term contract expire without value at the end of the coverage period when the insured party is still living variable life insuranceinsurance coverage through contract that give the policyholder flexibility in investment choice and depending on the product in premium payment and coverage amount with certain guarantee premium and account balance can be directed by the policyholder into variety of separate account investment option or directed to the company general account in the separate account investment option the policyholder bear the entire risk of the investment result with some product by maintaining certain premium level policyholder may have the advantage of various guarantee that may protect the death benefit from adverse investment experience universal life insuranceinsurance coverage on the basis variable life except that premium and the resulting accumulated balance are allocated only to the company general account with some product by maintaining certain premium level policyholder may have the advantage of various guarantee that may protect the death benefit from adverse investment experience dental insurance and aso arrangement that assist employee retiree and their family in maintaining oral health reducing of pocket expense disability insurance and aso arrangement for group and individual to provide benefit for income replacement payment of business overhead expense or mortgage protection in the event of the disability of the insured accident health insuranceaccident critical illness or hospital indemnity coverage to the insured vision insurance and effective with our acquisition of versant health through aso arrangement managed eye health and vision care solution to assist employee retiree and their family in maintaining vision health while reducing out of pocket expense offered to commercial group individual health plan and government sponsored program through nationwide provider network retail optical chain and online eyewear provider retirement and income solutionsour ri business provides funding and financing solution that help institutional customer mitigate and manage liability primarily associated with their employee benefit program using spectrum of life and annuity based insurance and investment product we distribute ri product and service through dedicated sale team and relationship manager primarily comprised of metlife employee we may sell product directly to benefit plan sponsor and advisor or through broker consultant or other intermediary in addition these sale professional work with individual group and global distribution area to better reach and service customer broker consultant and other intermediary major productsstable value product general account guaranteed interest contract gics are designed to provide stable value investment option within tax qualified defined contribution plan by offering fixed maturity investment with guarantee of liquidity at contract value for participant transaction separate account gics are available to defined contribution plan sponsor by offering market value return on separate account investment with general account guarantee of liquidity at contract value synthetic gics or wrap are contract available only to the sponsor of participant directed defined contribution plan the contract wrap portfolio of investment owned by the plan to provide guarantee that plan participant will always be able to transact in their account at contract value generally wrap contract mean that participant will not experience negative return private floating rate funding agreement are generally privately placed unregistered investment contract issued general account obligation with interest credited based on specified rate such the three month london interbank offered rate libor these agreement are used for money market fund security lending cash collateral portfolio and short term investment fund of contentspension risk transfersgeneral account and separate account annuity are offered in connection with defined benefit pension plan which include single premium buyout allowing for full or partial transfer of pension liability general account annuity include nonparticipating group contract benefit purchased for retired employee or active employee covered under terminating or ongoing pension plan they also include longevity reinsurance contract associated with the united kingdom the risk transfer market which provide fee income including risk fee in exchange for assuming longevity risk from pension plan insured by third party premium for longevity product which incorporate this fee are generally paid over the duration of the contract opposed to lump sum separate account annuity include both participating and non participating group contract benefit participating contract benefit are purchased for retired terminated or active employee covered under active or terminated pension plan the asset supporting the guaranteed benefit for each contract are held in separate account however the company fully guarantee all benefit payment non participating contract have economic feature similar to our general account product but offer the added protection of an insulated separate account under accounting principle generally accepted in the united state of america gaap these annuity contract are treated general account product institutional income annuitiesgeneral account contract that are guaranteed payout annuity purchased for employee upon retirement or termination of employment contract can be life or non life contingent non participating contract which do not provide for any loan or cash surrender value and with few exception do not permit future consideration structured settlementscustomized annuity designed to serve an alternative to lump sum payment in lawsuit initiated of personal injury wrongful death or worker compensation claim or other claim for damage surrender are generally not allowed although commutation are permitted in certain circumstance guaranteed payment consist of life contingent annuity term certain annuity and lump sum capital market investment product funding agreement backed note are offered in medium term note program under which funding agreement are issued to special purpose trust that issue marketable note in dollar or foreign currency the proceeds of these note issuance are used to acquire funding agreement with matching interest and maturity payment term from certain subsidiary of metlife inc the note are underwritten and marketed by major investment bank broker dealer operation and are sold to institutional investor funding agreement backed commercial paper is issued by special purpose limited liability company which deposit the proceeds under master funding agreement issued to it by metropolitan life insurance company mlic the commercial paper is issued in dollar or foreign currency receives the same short term credit rating mlic and is marketed by major investment bank broker dealer operation funding agreement are issued by certain of our insurance subsidiary to regional federal home loan bank fhlb and to subsidiary of the federal agricultural mortgage corporation farmer mac other product and servicesspecialized life insurance product and funding agreement designed specifically to provide solution for funding postretirement benefit and company bank or trust owned life insurance used to finance nonqualified benefit program for executive property casualtyour property casualty business offer personal line of property and casualty insurance including private passenger automobile homeowner and personal excess liability insurance in december the company entered into definitive agreement to sell it wholly owned subsidiary metropolitan property and casualty insurance company and certain of it wholly owned subsidiary collectively metlife to farmer group inc also the company and the farmer exchange have established year strategic partnership through which the farmer insurance group will offer it personal line product on metlife group benefit platform which will commence when the transaction close for further information on the pending disposition reported held for sale see note and of the note to the consolidated financial statement of contentswe market and sell property casualty product through independent agent property and casualty specialist and broker we are leading provider of personal line property and casualty insurance product offered to employee at their employer worksite marketing representative market personal line property and casualty insurance product to employer through variety of mean including broker referral and cross selling to group customer once permitted by the employer metlife commences marketing effort to employee enabling them to purchase coverage and to request payroll deduction over the telephone major operating joint venture in japan major productsvariable universal and term life insurancesimilar to product offered by our group benefit business except that these product were historically marketed to individual through various retail distribution channel for description of these product see group benefit whole life insurancea benefit upon the death of the insured in return for the periodic payment of fixed premium over predetermined period whole life insurance includes policy that provide participation feature in the form of dividend policyholder may receive dividend in cash or apply them to increase death benefit increase cash value available upon surrender or reduce the premium required to maintain the contract in force variable annuity asset accumulation and asset distribution need variable annuity allow the contractholder to allocate deposit into various investment option in separate account determined by the contractholder in certain variable annuity product contractholders may also choose to allocate all or portion of their account to the company general account and are credited with interest at rate we determine subject to specified minimum contractholders may also elect certain minimum death benefit and minimum living benefit guarantee for which additional fee are charged and asset allocation restriction may apply fixed and indexed linked annuitiesfixed annuity provide for asset accumulation and asset distribution need deposit made into deferred annuity contract are allocated to the company general account and are credited with interest at rate we determine subject to specified minimum fixed income annuity provide guaranteed monthly income for specified period of year and or for the life of the annuitant additionally the company ha issued indexed linked annuity which allow the contractholder to participate in return from equity index long term care protection against the potentially high cost of long term health care service generally pay benefit to insured need assistance with activity of daily living or have cognitive impairment of contentscorporate othercorporate other contains various start developing and run loan bearing interest rate commensurate with related borrowing and the company investment management business through which the company provides public fixed income private capital and real estate investment solution to institutional investor worldwide policyholder liabilitieswe establish and carry liability actuarially determined amount that are calculated to meet policy obligation when policy matures or is surrendered an insured dy or becomes disabled or upon the occurrence of other covered event or to provide for future annuity payment our liability for future policy benefit and claim are established based on estimate by actuary of much we will need to pay for future benefit and claim for life insurance and annuity product we calculate these liability based on assumption and estimate including estimated premium to be received over the assumed life of the policy the timing of the event covered by the insurance policy the amount of benefit or claim to be paid and the investment return on the investment we make with the premium we receive we establish liability for claim and benefit based on assumption and estimate of loss and liability incurred amount for actuarial liability are computed and reported on the consolidated financial statement in conformity with gaap for more detail on policyholder liability see management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation summary of critical accounting estimate liability for future policy benefit and management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation policyholder liability metlife inc insurance subsidiary including affiliated captive reinsurers establish statutory reserve under method prescribed by insurance law these reserve are reported liability and we expect them to be sufficient to meet policy and contract obligation when taken together with expected future premium and interest at assumed rate statutory reserve and actuarial liability for future policy benefit reported under gaap generally differ due to the difference in accounting requirement state insurance law and regulation require certain metlife entity to submit an annual opinion and memorandum of qualified actuary in it the qualified actuary state that the statutory reserve and related actuarial amount recorded in support of specified policy and contract and the asset supporting such statutory reserve and related actuarial amount adequately provide for the anticipated cash flow required to meet contractual obligation and related expense insurance regulator in many of the non jurisdiction in which we operate require certain metlife entity to prepare and submit sufficiency analysis of the reserve presented in the locally required regulatory financial statement see regulation insurance regulation policy and contract reserve adequacy analysis underwriting and pricing we use variety of underwriting and pricing management control our global risk management department develops product pricing standard and oversees underwriting practice in metlife insurance business we also regularly conduct experience study to monitor assumption against expectation impose formal new product approval process periodically update product profitability study and use reinsurance to manage our exposure appropriate see reinsurance activity underwritingour underwriter and actuary use detailed underwriting policy guideline and procedure to ass and quantify insurance risk and determine the type and the amount of risk we are willing to accept insurance underwriter consider an applicant medical history and other factor such financial profile foreign travel vocation and alcohol drug and tobacco use group insurance underwriter generally evaluate the risk characteristic of the prospective insured group but may underwrite member of group on an individual basis for certain voluntary product and coverage our employee generally perform our underwriting but intermediary review certain policy under guideline established by generally we are not obligated to accept any risk or group of risk from or to issue policy or group of policy to any employer or intermediary we review request for coverage on their merit and issue policy only after we have examined and approved the particular risk or group under our underwriting guideline of contentswe periodically review all our underwriting to maintain high standard of quality and consistency our reinsurers generally have the right to audit our underwriting we use underwriting policy guideline philosophy and strategy that we intend to be competitive and suitable for the customer the agent and to facilitate quality sale and to serve our customer need while supporting our financial strength and business objective we aim to ensure that underwriting risk level are appropriately reflected in our product pricing for our property casualty business our underwriting function ha six principal aspect evaluating potential voluntary and worksite employer account and independent agency establishing guideline for the binding of risk reviewing coverage bound by agent underwriting potential insured on case by case basis presented by agent outside the scope of their binding authority pursuing information necessary in certain case to enable issuance of policy within our guideline and ensuring that renewal policy continue to be written at rate commensurate with risk subject to very few exception agent in each of the distribution channel have binding authority for risk which fall within our published underwriting guideline risk falling outside the underwriting guideline may be submitted for approval to the underwriting department alternatively agent in such situation may call the underwriting department to obtain authorization to bind the risk in most state we generally have the right within specified period usually the first day to cancel any policy we continually review our underwriting guideline in light of applicable regulation and to ensure that our policy remain competitive support our marketing strategy and profitability goal and otherwise remain appropriate pricingproduct pricing reflects our globally consistent standard global risk management and regional finance and product team price and oversee all of our insurance business we base our pricing on the expected benefit payout which we calculate through the use of assumption for mortality morbidity expense persistency and investment return and macroeconomic factor such inflation we price investment oriented product based on factor such investment return expense persistency optionality and possible variability of result our pricing of certain product may include prospective and retrospective experience rating feature for prospective experience rating we evaluate past experience to determine future premium rate and we bear all prior year gain and loss for retrospective experience rating we evaluate past experience to determine our cost of providing insurance for the customer in light of any feature that allow to recoup certain loss or distribute certain gain back to the policyholder based on prior year experience we base our rate for group benefit product on anticipated earnings and expense for the book of business we generally evaluate renewal annually or biannually and re price product to reflect our experience on such product we price ri product on demand our pricing reflects our expected investment return well mortality longevity and expense assumption ri business is generally nonparticipating and illiquid policyholder have few or no option or contractual right to cash value however for our stable value business pricing reflects the contractholders ability to withdraw at book value over period of time well our ability to reset rate periodically we generally must receive regulatory approval of rate for individual life insurance product such rate are highly regulated even where we are not required to obtain advance regulatory approval we generally renew such product annually and they may include pricing term that are guaranteed for certain period of time we price individual disability income product based on anticipated result by occupation our rate for fixed and variable annuity product are also highly regulated and we also generally must receive regulatory approval of them such product generally include penalty for early withdrawal and policyholder benefit election to tailor benefit to policyholder need we periodically reevaluate the cost of such option and adjust pricing level on our guarantee we may also reevaluate the type and level of guarantee feature we offer of contentsfor our property casualty business our ability to set and change rate is subject to regulatory oversight rate for our major line of property and casualty insurance are based on our proprietary database rather than relying on rating bureau we determine price in part from number of variable specific to each risk the pricing of personal line insurance product take into account among other thing the expected frequency and severity of loss the cost of providing coverage including the cost of acquiring policyholder and administering policy benefit and other administrative and overhead cost such reinsurance competitive factor and profit consideration the major pricing variable for personal line insurance include characteristic of the insured property such age make and model or construction type well characteristic of the insured such driving record and loss experience and the insured personal financial management condition of our license to do business in each state we like all other personal line insurer are required to write or share the cost of private passenger automobile and homeowner insurance for higher risk individual who would otherwise be unable to obtain such insurance this involuntary market also called the shared market is governed by the applicable law and regulation of each state and policy written in this market are generally written at rate higher than standard rate and typically afford le coverage we continually review our pricing guideline in light of applicable regulation and to ensure that our policy remain competitive support our marketing strategy and profitability goal and otherwise remain appropriate reinsurance activity we enter into reinsurance agreement primarily purchaser of reinsurance for our various insurance product we also provide reinsurance for some third party insurance product we participate in reinsurance in order to limit loss minimize exposure to significant risk and provide additional capacity for future growth our reinsurance cover individual risk group risk or defined block of business primarily on coinsurance yearly renewable term excess or catastrophe excess basis the extent of our retained risk depends on our risk evaluation subject in certain circumstance to maximum retention limit based on our risk appetite we also cede first dollar mortality risk under certain contract we reinsure both mortality and other risk we obtain reinsurance for capital requirement purpose and when it economic impact make it appropriate to do so we also reinsure for risk and capital management purpose among affiliate including affiliated captive reinsurers captive reinsurers are affiliated insurance company licensed such under the special purpose financial captive law adopted by several state including vermont and south carolina captive insurer very narrow business plan restrict most or all of their activity to reinsuring business from their affiliate see management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation liquidity and capital resource the company capital affiliated captive reinsurance transaction for information regarding reinsurance by segment our catastrophic coverage and ceded reinsurance recoverable balance national association of insurance commissioner regarding group wide supervision each of metlife insurance subsidiary is licensed and regulated in each jurisdiction where it conduct insurance business reviewing and approving certain policy form including required policyholder disclosure regulating unfair trade and claim practice including through the imposition of restriction on marketing and sale with the novel coronavirus covid pandemic the covid pandemic some of which have since expired these encourage request or direct health life and property and casualty insurance company to waive cost sharing for coronavirus covid testing cover telehealth service provide extended grace period for premium payment forbear on the cancellation or non renewal of policy due to non payment of premium expand coverage for state mandated disability and family leave benefit to address covid related event and provide other policyholder accommodation for example the new york state department of financial service nydfs required life insurance or annuity authorized insurer to extend premium and fee payment grace period to day for policyholder who demonstrated covid pandemic related financial hardship the nydfs also prohibited new york licensed insurer from imposing any late fee on or reporting policyholder to credit reporting or debt collection agency for failure to timely pay any life or annuity premium and required such insurer to allow policyholder to pay the premium over month period insurer were required to accept policyholder written attestation proof of financial hardship result of the covid pandemic federal initiativesu federal initiative often affect our business in variety of way including regulation of financial service security derivative pension health care money laundering foreign sanction and corrupt practice and taxation in addition legislator and policymakers propose various form of direct and indirect federal regulation of insurance from time to time including proposal for the establishment of an optional federal charter for insurance company see risk factor regulatory and legal risk change in law or regulation or in supervisory and enforcement policy may reduce our profitability limit our growth or otherwise adversely affect the dodd frank wall street reform and consumer protection act dodd frank increased the potential federal role in regulating business such including in the following way the financial stability oversight council may designate certain financial company non bank systemically important financial institution non bank sifi subject to supervision by the board of governor of the federal reserve system federal reserve board and the federal reserve bank of new york collectively with the federal reserve board the federal reserve the federal insurance office within the department of the treasury may participate in the negotiation of international insurance agreement with foreign regulator for the collect information about the insurance industry and recommend prudential standard if an insurance holding company such metlife inc or another non insurance financial institution were to become insolvent or were in danger of defaulting on it obligation and regulator determined that this would have serious adverse effect on financial stability in the the federal deposit insurance corporation fdic may liquidate such company receiver in that case the bankruptcy code which ordinarily governs liquidation would not apply the fdic purpose would be to mitigate the systemic risk the institution failure pose this is different objective from that of bankruptcy trustee under the bankruptcy code in such liquidation the holder of such company debt could in certain respect be treated differently than under the bankruptcy code the fdic ha established rule relating to the priority of creditor claim and the potentially dissimilar treatment of similarly situated creditor these provision could apply to some financial institution whose outstanding debt security we hold in our investment portfolio however state insurance law would continue to apply to an insurance company resolution dodd frank provision may also affect the investment and investment activity of metlife inc and it subsidiary including imposing federal regulation of such activity dodd frank and it implementing regulation have changed since the law wa adopted result of these change and potential change we can not identify all the risk and opportunity if any they pose to our business see risk factor regulatory and legal risk change in law or regulation or in supervisory and enforcement policy may reduce our profitability limit our growth or otherwise adversely affect of contentsthe federal government response to the covid pandemic ha affected for example the federal government established paid sick leave and expanded other leave law to cover certain covid pandemic related event the federal government also added certain tax favored withdrawal and increased loan withdrawal limitation from eligible retirement plan and temporarily waived required minimum distribution rule for qualified retirement plan participant and individual retirement account ira owner we also granted concession to certain of our commercial agricultural and residential mortgage loan borrower including payment deferral and other loan modification well to certain of our lessee operating and direct financing lease primarily in the form of rent deferral in addition we have made certain accounting election regarding loan and lease statutory reserve adequacy in each case qualified actuary must submit an opinion that state that the statutory reserve make adequate provision according to accepted actuarial standard of practice for the anticipated cash flow required by the contractual obligation and related expense of the insurance subsidiary the actuary considers the adequacy of the statutory reserve in light of the asset held by the insurer with respect to such reserve and related actuarial item such the investment earnings on such asset and the consideration the insurer anticipates receiving and retaining under the related policy and contract we may increase reserve in order to submit such an opinion without qualification our insurance subsidiary that must provide these opinion have done so without qualification since this requirement began many of our non insurance operation must also analyze the adequacy of their statutory reserve in most of those case locally qualified actuary must submit an analysis of the likelihood that the reserve make adequate provision for the insurer associated contractual obligation and related expense regulatory and actuarial analytic standard vary widely national association of insurance commissioner the naic assist state insurance regulatory authority to serve the public interest and achieve their regulatory goal state insurance regulator may act independently or adopt regulation proposed by the naic state insurance regulator and the naic regularly re examine existing insurance law and regulation state insurance regulator establish standard and best practice conduct peer review and coordinate their regulatory oversight through the naic the naic also provides standardized insurance industry accounting and reporting guidance through it accounting practice and procedure manual the manual which state have largely adopted by regulation however individual state establish statutory accounting principle which may differ from the manual change to the manual or modification by the various state insurance department may affect the statutory capital and surplus of metlife inc insurance subsidiary of contentsu state insurance holding company law and regulation are generally based on the naic model holding company act and regulation these vary from jurisdiction to jurisdiction but generally require controlled insurance company insurer that are subsidiary of insurance holding company to register and file report with state regulatory authority on it capital structure ownership financial condition intercompany transaction and general business operation they require the ultimate controlling person of insurer to file an annual enterprise risk report with the lead state of the insurance holding company system this report identifies risk likely to have material adverse effect upon the financial condition or liquidity of the insurer or it insurance holding company system whole each of our insurance subsidiary domiciliary state ha enacted law to implement these requirement including the enterprise risk reporting requirement the holding company law also authorize state insurance commissioner to act global group wide supervisor for internationally active insurance group iaigs well other insurer that choose to opt in for the group wide supervision these law provide confidentiality protection for communication with the group wide supervisor nearly all state have adopted law and regulation enhancing group wide supervision in the nydfs amended it law to permit the new york superintendent of financial service superintendent to act group wide supervisor for iaigs in furtherance of the naic solvency modernization initiative the naic ha updated model act and regulation to address insurance company financial regulation and in particular capital requirement corporate governance and risk management practice group supervision liquidity stress testing statutory accounting and financial reporting and reinsurance the naic corporate governance annual disclosure model act requires insurer to annually file detailed information regarding their corporate governance policy of december it had been substantially adopted by most state each of our insurance subsidiary domiciliary state ha also adopted the risk management and own risk and solvency assessment model act which requires insurer to maintain risk management framework and to document an internal own risk and solvency assessment orsa of it material risk in normal and stressed environment metlife inc ha submitted on behalf of the enterprise an orsa summary report to the nydfs annually since this requirement became effective the naic ha also approved valuation manual containing principle based approach to the calculation of life insurance reserve the valuation manual principle based reserving pbr is designed to better address reserving for life insurance and annuity product principle based reserving ha been adopted by all the domiciliary state of metlife insurance subsidiary the nydfs promulgated regulation in that affirms the superintendent authority to deviate from the valuation manual to adjust the reserve of new york domestic life insurance company such mlic if the nydfs determines that an alternative requirement would be in the best interest of new york policyholder in february the nydfs amended the regulation result of december we increased our statutory reserve by approximately million and our statutory capital requirement by approximately million over the prior reserve and capital requirement we graded these effect into our statutory financial statement over one year period so the full impact is reflected of december the naic ha been focused on macro prudential initiative since which is intended to enhance risk identification effort by building on the state based regulation system in furtherance of this initiative the naic adopted change to it statutory annual statement reporting effective for year end to improve liquidity risk monitoring in december the naic adopted amendment to the model holding company holding act and regulation that implement requirement related to liquidity stress testing framework consistent with metlife liquidity risk policy and procedure for certain large life insurer and insurance group to be used regulatory tool based on amount of certain type of business written or material exposure to certain investment transaction such derivative and security lending these amendment have to be adopted by state legislature to become effective we use capital market solution to finance portion of our statutory reserve requirement for several product these include level premium term life product subject to the naic valuation of life insurance policy model regulation commonly referred to regulation xxx universal and variable life policy with secondary guarantee ulsg subject to naic actuarial guideline commonly referred to guideline axxx and mlic closed block the naic created regulatory framework applicable to the use of captive insurer in connection with regulation xxx and guideline axxx transaction which ha enhanced statutory financial statement disclosure of an insurer use of captive the framework narrowed the type of asset permitted to back statutory reserve that are required to support the insurer future obligation of contentsthe naic also requires the actuary of ceding insurer to opine on the insurer reserve and to issue qualified opinion if the framework described set forth in actuarial guideline ag is not followed the naic term and universal life insurance reserve financing model regulation contains the same substantive requirement ag amended by the naic in and it establishes uniform national standard governing reserve financing arrangement pertaining to the term life and universal life insurance policy with secondary guarantee this model regulation ha only been adopted by few state including one of our insurance subsidiary domiciliary state we can not predict the capital and reserve impact compliance cost or other effect these initiative will have on our business financial condition or result of operation surplus and capitalinsurers must maintain their capital and surplus at or above minimum level prescribed by the law of their respective jurisdiction regulator generally have discretionary authority to limit or prohibit an insurer sale to policyholder if the insurer ha not maintained minimum surplus or capital or if they find that the further transaction of business will be hazardous to policyholder state insurance statute also typically restrict the dividend or other distribution an insurance company subsidiary may pay to it parent company and limit the transaction between an insurer and it affiliate dividend in excess of prescribed limit and transaction above specified size between an insurer and it affiliate require the approval of the insurance regulator in the insurer state of domicile see management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation liquidity and capital resource metlife inc liquidity and capital source dividend from subsidiary see also dividend restriction in note of the note to the consolidated financial statement for further information regarding such limitation non jurisdiction also restrict the amount of such dividend and other distribution for example portion of the annual earnings of our japan operation may be repatriated each year and may further be distributed to metlife inc dividend we may determine not to repatriate profit from the japan operation or to repatriate reduced amount in order to maintain or improve the solvency of the japan operation or for other reason in addition the financial service agency in japan fsa may limit or not permit profit repatriation or other transfer of fund to the if such transfer would be detrimental to the solvency or financial strength of our japan operation or for other reason several non insurance regulator urged insurance company to preserve fund during the covid pandemic for example the eiopa suggested that insurance company temporarily suspend discretionary dividend during the covid pandemic for development that could affect our ratio of free cash flow to adjusted earnings result and thus our surplus and capital see risk factor risk based capitalmost of our insurance subsidiary are subject to risk based capital rbc requirement developed by the naic and adopted by their respective domiciliary state insurer calculate rbc annually based on formula that applies factor to various asset premium claim expense and statutory reserve item taking into account asset insurance interest rate and market and business risk characteristic regulator use the formula an early warning tool to identify insurer that may be inadequately capitalized for purpose of initiating regulatory action and not mean to rank insurer generally state insurance law provide insurance regulator the authority to require various action by or take various action against insurer whose total adjusted capital doe not meet or exceed certain rbc level we expect our statutory financial statement to reflect that the total adjusted capital of each of our subsidiary subject to these requirement wa in excess of each of those rbc level at year end they did for year end see statutory equity and income in note of the note to the consolidated financial statement and management discussion and analysis of financial condition and result of operation liquidity and capital resource the december and we are not aware of any upcoming naic adoption or state insurance department regulation change that would have material impact on our naic based combined rbc ratio the naic adopted revision to certain factor used to calculate life rbc which is the denominator of the rbc ratio in light of change to tax law in recent year these revision have resulted in increased rbc charge and reduced the rbc ratio of our insurance subsidiary the naic is also studying rbc revision for real estate equity bond and longevity risk but it is premature to project the impact of any potential regulatory change resulting from such proposal the naic developed group capital calculation tool using an rbc aggregation methodology for all entity within the insurance holding company system including non entity in december the naic adopted the group capital calculation template and instruction well amendment to the model holding company act and regulation the amendment implement the annual filing requirement for the group capital calculation that now have to be adopted by state legislature or regulatory agency to become effective we can not predict impact such regulatory tool may have on our business in the naic issued guidance on rbc addressing debt restructuring due to the economic impact of the covid pandemic where the counterparty might seek concession the guidance provides that an insurer doe not need to reclassify the rbc category of some loan or other asset on which it ha granted concession this may avoid higher capital charge for the asset the naic extended this guidance through january in further support of the use of prudent loan modification to mitigate the impact of the covid pandemic solvency regimesour insurance business throughout the eea is subject to the solvency ii directive and it implementing rule these cover the capital adequacy risk management and regulatory reporting for insurer and reinsurers solvency ii harmonizes insurance regulation across the european union eu each eea member state ha transposed the solvency ii directive into it regulatory architecture it capital requirement are forward looking and based on the risk profile of each individual insurance company in order to promote comparability transparency and competitiveness in line with the requirement impacted metlife entity calculate and report their solvency capital requirement using standard formula prescribed by the solvency ii directive and further regulation by the european commission the ceased to be member of the eu in january and following the expiry of transition period on december the is no longer subject to eu law the relationship between the and the eu is now governed by the term and condition of trade and cooperation agreement the trade agreement the trade agreement doe not contain many substantive provision relating to financial service and therefore there is currently no change to capital adequacy risk management and regulatory reporting requirement for authorized insurer and reinsurers however it is possible that the domestic prudential regime may begin to diverge from the solvency ii directive over time the is currently undertaking review of the solvency ii directive and of the regulatory regime that is applicable to authorized insurer and reinsurers we expect to maintain our existing operating model including an inbound eea insurer under the temporary permission regime tpr which is due to last for at least three year and will permit metlife to carry on it insurance business in the during that period mexico ha adopted solvency ii type regulatory framework which imposes reserve and capital requirement and corporate governance to foster transparency in line with the requirement of the local solvency ii insurance company calculate and report their capital requirement using standard formula designed by the local regulator cnsf in addition required certain metlife entity must submit annual orsa report to the cnsf on an ongoing basis in chile the law implementing solvency ii like regulation continues in the study stage the implementation date for the new solvency regime ha not yet been set however it could be in force within four year after the final regulation is published metlife chile timely implemented governance change and risk policy to comply with prior regulatory change metlife chile also submitted it most recent risk appetite framework and orsa report to the regulator in december of contentsthe superintendence of private insurance the brazilian insurance regulator ha established an insurance framework for minimum capital requirement based on risk criterion for investment activity formal risk management function and formal enterprise risk management framework metlife brazil ha formalized the designation of local risk manager and implemented governance structure and risk management framework component in accordance with local regulatory requirement japanese law requires insurer to maintain solvency standard to protect policyholder and to support their own financial strength most japanese life insurer maintain solvency margin ratio well in excess of the legally mandated minimum in addition we expect japan to introduce an economic value based solvency regime within the next few year in china the business of our joint venture well the industry ha been implementing china risk oriented solvency system ross risk based solvency regime like solvency ii ross focus on risk management and ha three pillar strengthen quantitative capital requirement enhance qualitative supervision and establish governance and market discipline process the korea financial supervisory service plan to implement new solvency system by we expect this system to reflect the international association of insurance supervisor iais global insurance capital standard and incorporate certain product portfolio and other feature specific to the korean market we also expect this system to include mark to market valuation which would generally increase capital requirement iaisthe iais is an association of insurance supervisor and regulator and member of the financial stability board fsb an international entity established to coordinate develop and promote regulatory supervisory and other financial sector policy in the interest of financial stability the iais participates in the fsb initiative to identify and manage systemic risk globally the iais ha adopted holistic framework for the assessment and mitigation of systemic risk in the global insurance sector the holistic framework the framework monitor the build up of vulnerability at jurisdictional and global level to address any such risk through the application of enhanced supervisory measure based on existing insurance core principle and the common framework for supervision of iaigs the fsb annually designated metlife inc globally systemically important insurer sii from to but the fsb suspended our sii identification beginning in the fsb may discontinue or re establish the sii designation system based on the implementation result of the holistic framework an iais proposal becomes effective when it is enacted through legislation or regulation in the applicable jurisdiction metlife inc is not non bank sifi the impact on metlife inc of the iais global proposal is uncertain new york insurance regulation regulation establishes standard for the determination and any readjustment of non guaranteed element nges that may vary at the insurer discretion for life insurance policy and annuity contract delivered or issued for delivery in new york nges include cost of insurance for universal life insurance policy well interest crediting rate for annuity and universal life insurance policy the regulation requires insurer to notify policyholder at least day in advance of any change in nges that is adverse to policyholder and with respect to life insurance to notify the nydfs at least day prior to any such change the regulation also requires insurer to inform the nydfs annually of any change adverse to policyholder made in the prior year the regulation generally prohibits insurer from increasing profit margin for in force policy or adjusting nges in order to recoup past loss cybersecurity and privacy regulationvarious federal and state government agency protect the privacy and security of personal information number of jurisdiction outside the safeguard the privacy and security of personal information these law and rule vary significantly from jurisdiction to jurisdiction insurance and other regulator are also increasingly focused on cybersecurity new york cybersecurity regulation for financial service institution including banking and insurance entity under it jurisdiction requires these entity to establish and maintain cybersecurity program designed to protect consumer private data the regulation requires covered entity to ass risk associated with their information system and establish and maintain cybersecurity program designed to protect the confidentiality integrity and availability of such system and data specifically it provides for control relating to the governance framework for cybersecurity program ii risk based minimum standard for technology system for data protection iii minimum standard for cyber breach response including notice to the nydfs of material event and iv identification and documentation of material deficiency remediation plan and annual certification of regulatory compliance to the nydfs of contentsthe naic insurance data security model law the cybersecurity model law established standard for data security and for the investigation of and notification of insurance commissioner of cybersecurity event involving unauthorized access to or the misuse of certain nonpublic information the cybersecurity model law imposes regulatory requirement intended to protect the confidentiality integrity and availability of information system several state have adopted the cybersecurity model law including some of our insurance subsidiary domiciliary state california resident have the right to know what information business ha collected from them and the sourcing and sharing of that information they also have right to have business delete their personal information with some exception and in certain instance to limit the use of their personal information regulator may impose fine for violation and individual have private right of action for any unauthorized disclosure of personal information result of failure to maintain reasonable security procedure while significant portion of our business is exempted from these specific requirement health insurance portability and accountability act and the insurance law of several state grant similar right to insured the general data protection regulation gdpr establishes uniform data privacy law across the eu the data protection act of gdpr implement provision of the gdpr with respect to personal data originating from within the gdpr and the gdpr apply to eu and entity respectively well entity not established in the eu and or the that offer good or service to data subject in the eu and or the or monitor consumer behavior that take place in the eu and or the regulator may impose fine for non compliance following the exit from the eu the gdpr may diverge from gdpr over time erisa fiduciary consideration and other pension and retirement regulationwe provide product and service to certain employee benefit plan that are subject to erisa and the internal revenue code of amended the code erisa and the code impose restriction including fiduciary duty to perform solely in the interest of erisa plan participant and beneficiary and to avoid certain prohibited transaction the applicable provision of erisa and the code are subject to enforcement by the department of labor dol the internal revenue service irs and the pension benefit guaranty corporation the prohibited transaction rule of erisa and the code generally restrict the provision of investment advice to erisa plan and participant and ira if the investment recommendation result in fee paid to an individual advisor the firm that employ the advisor or their affiliate that vary according to the investment recommendation chosen unless an exemption or exception is available similarly without an exemption or exception fiduciary advisor are prohibited from receiving compensation from third party in connection with their advice erisa also affect certain of our in force insurance policy and annuity contract well insurance policy and annuity contract we may sell in the future the sec adopted regulation best interest in requiring broker dealer to act in the best interest of individual investor retail client when recommending security or investment strategy including recommendation to ira owner well non benefit plan retail client in addition broker dealer and investment adviser to retail client must describe their service and conflict of interest to their retail customer in client relationship summary disclosure and deliver copy of the form to their retail customer in december the dol released the final version of the prohibited transaction exemption pte to allow investment advice fiduciary to receive compensation without violating erisa subject to impartial conduct standard and disclosure obligation aligned with the new sec rule in the preamble to pte the dol also provided it final interpretation of the five part test used to determine whether person is acting an erisa investment advice fiduciary pte became effective on february the new presidential administration ha ordered pause on regulatory change initiated it took office result it may delay change or withdraw this rule state regulator and legislature in nevada new jersey maryland and new york have proposed measure that would make broker dealer sale agent and investment adviser and their representative subject to fiduciary duty when providing product and service to customer including pension plan and ira and massachusetts ha enacted law to that effect the nydfs regulation incorporates the best interest standard and expands the scope of the regulation beyond annuity transaction to include sale of life insurance policy to consumer this regulation best interest under the security exchange act of amended exchange act doe not include private right of action although the sec did not indicate an intent to pre empt state regulation in this area and some of the state proposal and adopted regulation would allow for private right of action result of these development it is possible that it may become more costly to provide our product and service in the state subject to the new rule in the chilean congress approved two bill each one of which allowed individual to withdraw up to of pension account or the account balance if it is below certain amount provida and other company in the industry continue to process such payment chile also continues to consider further pension reform that could affect our business of contentsconsumer protection lawsnumerous federal and state law affect our earnings and activity including federal and state consumer protection law part of dodd frank congress established the consumer financial protection bureau cfpb to supervise and regulate institution that provide certain financial product and service to consumer although the consumer financial service subject to the cfpb jurisdiction generally exclude insurance business of the kind in which we engage the cfpb doe have authority to regulate non insurance consumer service we provide consumer protection law in non jurisdiction may also affect investment regulationstate law and regulation limit the amount of investment that our insurance subsidiary may have in certain asset category such below investment grade fixed income security real estate equity other equity investment and derivative and require diversification of investment portfolio investment exceeding regulatory limitation are not admitted for purpose of measuring surplus in some instance law require to divest any non qualifying investment in addition many of our non insurance subsidiary and pension company are subject to other investment law and regulation changing global financial and economic environment and the fiscal and monetary policy of government and central bank around the world continue to affect our global insurance business these may affect interest rate and thereby the pricing level of risk bearing investment well our business operation investment portfolio and derivative derivative regulationdodd frank includes framework of regulation of the over the counter otc derivative market requiring clearing of certain type of interest rate and credit default swap transaction and imposes additional cost including reporting and margin requirement our cost of risk mitigation are increasing under dodd frank for example dodd frank imposes requirement to pledge variation and or initial margin for otc cleared transaction otc derivative that are cleared and settled through central clearing counterparties and ii for otc bilateral transaction otc derivative that are bilateral contract between two counterparties the margin requirement for otc cleared transaction and the variation margin requirement for otc bilateral derivative are already in effect while the initial margin requirement for otc bilateral swap transaction are expected to become applicable to in september we expect increased margin requirement and capital charge for our counterparties and central clearinghouses related to holding non cash collateral to continue to increase our required holding of cash and government security this may cause lower yield and reduce our income due to le favorable pricing for otc cleared and otc bilateral transaction centralized clearing of certain otc derivative expose to the risk of default by clearing member or clearinghouse with respect to our cleared derivative transaction we use derivative to mitigate wide range of risk in connection with our business including the impact of increased benefit exposure from certain of our annuity product that offer guaranteed benefit we have always been subject to the risk that hedging and other management procedure might prove ineffective in reducing the risk to which insurance policy expose or that unanticipated policyholder behavior or mortality combined with adverse market event could produce economic loss beyond the scope of the risk management technique employed any such loss could be increased by higher cost of writing derivative including customized derivative and the reduced availability of customized derivative that might result from the implementation of dodd frank and comparable international derivative regulation dodd frank also expanded the definition of swap and mandated the sec and commodity future trading commission cftc to study whether stable value contract should be treated swap pursuant to the new definition and the sec and cftc interpretive regulation product offered by our insurance subsidiary other than stable value contract might also be treated swap should such product become regulated swap we can not predict how the rule would be applied to them or the effect on such product profitability or attractiveness to our client special federal banking rule apply to certain qualified financial contract including many derivative contract security lending agreement and repurchase agreement with banking institution and certain of their affiliate these rule generally require the banking institution and their applicable affiliate to limit or delay their counterparties default right such the right to terminate the contract or foreclose on collateral and restrict assignment and transfer of credit enhancement such guarantee in connection with the banking institution or affiliate bankruptcy insolvency resolution or similar proceeding these rule could limit our recovery in the event of default limit our ability to close out transaction upon the bankruptcy of an affiliate of our counterparty and increase our counterparty risk of contentswe expect the amount of collateral we are required to pledge and the payment we are required to make under our otc swap transaction to increase result of the requirement to pledge initial margin for otc bilateral transaction based on the final margin requirement for non centrally cleared derivative the sec capital requirement for swap dealer and major swap participant are scheduled to take effect in october however we do not expect these requirement to affect our business significantly security broker dealer and investment adviser regulationu federal and state security law and regulation apply to insurance product that are also security including variable annuity contract and variable life insurance policy and certain fixed interest rate or index linked contract with feature that require them to be deemed security or sold through private placement issuance result some of our subsidiary and their activity in offering and selling variable insurance contract and policy are subject to extensive regulation under these security law federal and state security law and regulation generally grant regulatory agency broad rulemaking and enforcement power including the power to adopt new rule impacting new or existing product regulate the issuance sale and distribution of our product and limit or restrict the conduct of business for failure to comply with such law and regulation in some non jurisdiction some of our insurance product are considered security under local law and we may be subject to local security regulation and oversight by local security regulator some of our subsidiary and their activity in offering and selling variable insurance product are subject to extensive regulation under the federal security law and regulation administered by the sec these subsidiary issue variable annuity contract and variable life insurance policy through separate account that are registered with the sec investment company under the investment company act of amended the investment company act or are exempt from registration under the investment company act such separate account are generally divided into sub account each of which invests in an underlying mutual fund which is registered investment company under the investment company act in addition the variable annuity contract and variable life insurance policy associated with these registered separate account are registered with the sec under the security act of amended the security act or are exempt from registration under the security act one insurance subsidiary issue fixed interest rate contract with feature that require it to be registered security under the security act some of our subsidiary are registered with the sec broker dealer under the exchange act and are member of and subject to regulation by finra certain variable contract separate account sponsored by our subsidiary are exempt from registration but may be subject to other provision of the federal security law the sec cftc and finra from time to time propose rule and regulation that impact product deemed to be security one of our subsidiary is registered an investment adviser with the sec under the investment adviser act of amended and is also registered an investment adviser in various state and non jurisdiction applicable in addition we have other non subsidiary that are registered or licensed in non jurisdiction to conduct our investment management business we may also be subject to similar law and regulation in non jurisdiction where we provide investment advisory service or conduct other activity under sec rule broker dealer recommending our variable product and other security offering to retail customer are required to comply with best interest standard the rule also requires broker dealer to disclose the nature of service their standard of conduct and their conflict of interest to their retail customer with regard to insurance product the naic revised it suitability in annuity transaction model regulation to add best interest standard for the sale of annuity but only one of our insurance subsidiary domiciliary state ha adopted it and it is under consideration in another domiciliary state federal and state security regulatory authority and finra and take corrective action when warranted of contentsenvironmental law and regulationsas an owner and operator of real property in many jurisdiction we are subject to extensive environmental law and property in addition we hold equity interest in company that could potentially be subject to environmental liability we routinely have environmental assessment performed with respect to real estate acquired for investment and real property to be acquired through foreclosure unexpected environmental liability may arise however based on information currently available to we believe that any cost associated with compliance with environmental law and regulation or any remediation of such property will not have material adverse effect on our business result of operation or financial condition
